title: Beacon crash loop after docker restart: does not match the latest block header signing root in state
body:
# üêû Bug Report

### Description

Beacon node is unable to start after a docker restart command

Shutdown looks clean to me
```
time="2020-11-13 14:24:07" level=info msg="Got interrupt, shutting down..." prefix=node
time="2020-11-13 14:24:07" level=info msg="Stopping beacon node" prefix=node
time="2020-11-13 14:24:07" level=warning msg="Subscription next failed" error="context canceled" prefix=sync topic="/eth2/e7a75d5a/beacon_aggregate_and_proof/ssz_snappy"
time="2020-11-13 14:24:07" level=warning msg="Subscription next failed" error="context canceled" prefix=sync topic="/eth2/e7a75d5a/voluntary_exit/ssz_snappy"
time="2020-11-13 14:24:07" level=warning msg="Subscription next failed" error="context canceled" prefix=sync topic="/eth2/e7a75d5a/attester_slashing/ssz_snappy"
time="2020-11-13 14:24:07" level=warning msg="Subscription next failed" error="context canceled" prefix=sync topic="/eth2/e7a75d5a/beacon_attestation_56/ssz_snappy"
time="2020-11-13 14:24:07" level=warning msg="Subscription next failed" error="context canceled" prefix=sync topic="/eth2/e7a75d5a/beacon_block/ssz_snappy"
time="2020-11-13 14:24:07" level=warning msg="Subscription next failed" error="context canceled" prefix=sync topic="/eth2/e7a75d5a/beacon_attestation_42/ssz_snappy"
time="2020-11-13 14:24:07" level=warning msg="Subscription next failed" error="context canceled" prefix=sync topic="/eth2/e7a75d5a/proposer_slashing/ssz_snappy"
time="2020-11-13 14:24:08" level=info msg="Peer disconnected" activePeers=29 [...]
[...]
```

Next startup is now a crash loop
```

time="2020-11-13 14:24:09" level=warning msg="Using Head Sync flag, it starts syncing from last saved head."

time="2020-11-13 14:24:11" level=info msg="Starting beacon node" prefix=node version="Prysm/v1.0.0-beta.1/4dcae8707a91ccd9e2278625a6f26e926c3b559e. Built at: 2020-11-06 21:25:47+00:00"
time="2020-11-13 14:24:11" level=info msg="gRPC server listening on port" address="0.0.0.0:4000" prefix=rpc
time="2020-11-13 14:24:11" level=info msg="Starting JSON-HTTP API" address="0.0.0.0:3500" prefix=gateway
time="2020-11-13 14:24:11" level=warning msg="You are using an insecure gRPC server. If you are running your beacon node and validator on the same machines, you can ignore this message. If you want to know how to enable secure connections, see: https://docs.prylabs.network/docs/prysm-usage/secure-grpc" prefix=rpc
time="2020-11-13 14:24:11" level=info msg="Connected to eth1 proof-of-work chain" endpoint="http://geth:8545" prefix=powchain

time="2020-11-13 14:24:14" level=warning msg="Running on Medalla Testnet" prefix=flags
```



### Has this worked before in a previous version?

Yes

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

docker restart beacon

## üî• Error

See description

## üåç  Your Environment

**Operating System:**

OpenMediaVault (Debian)

**What version of Prysm are you running? (Which release)**

Docker container with "Prysm/v1.0.0-beta.1/4dcae8707a91ccd9e2278625a6f26e926c3b559e. Built at: 2020-11-06 21:25:47+00:00"

**Anything else relevant (validator index / public key)?**

@littleskunk we have diagnosed this and looks like this happens when you were running on a different chain, such as mainnet, and then restart with --medalla or vice versa. Can you confirm you were running the --medalla flag before the restart (when you shutdown) and after the restart?

I executed a docker restart command. I am not using a config file. Even if I would have changed my docker compose file (I haven't) docker restart would not apply that change and keep running the old option. As you can see after the restart the medalla flag was set so it must have been present before as well.

This was the last block that my beacon node picked up:
```
time="2020-11-13 14:23:44" level=info msg="Synced new block" block=0x920f73fa... epoch=22738 finalizedEpoch=22734 finalizedRoot=0x4005b656... prefix=blockchain slot=727618 slotInEpoch=2
time="2020-11-13 14:23:44" level=info msg="Finished applying state transition" attestations=128 attesterSlashings=0 deposits=0 prefix=blockchain proposerSlashings=0 voluntaryExits=0
```
